alert.note: Alert for Dawes; North Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 04 at 9:10PM CDT until April 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Winter Storm Warnings will remain in effect through 6 pm Wednesday. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches expected with the higher amounts in the Pine Ridge. Wind gusts of 20 to 30 MPH. The snow will begin to taper off tonight and Wednesday, but the gusty winds will continue through Wednesday creating blowing snow and reduced visibility. * WHERE...In Nebraska, Dawes County and Northern Sioux County. In Wyoming, Niobrara County. * WHEN...Blizzard Warning, until 6 PM MDT Today. Winter Storm Warnings will remain in effect until 6pm Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
